text: I just joined this channel, can anyone guide me what is this channel about? Any specific projects or such?

elements.text: I just joined this channel, can anyone guide me what is this channel about? Any specific projects or such?

text: hi, welcome!  the channel is about the use of Julia in astronomy/astrophysics, no specific project

elements.text: hi, welcome!  the channel is about the use of Julia in astronomy/astrophysics, no specific project

text: Thanks! Btw I wanted to give it a try to write and publish a paper on Julia astronomy..any suggestions? I'd really appreciate if I get a guide as well.

elements.text: Thanks! Btw I wanted to give it a try to write and publish a paper on Julia astronomy..any suggestions? I'd really appreciate if I get a guide as well.

text: could you please elaborate on what you want to do?

elements.text: could you please elaborate on what you want to do?

text: Anything related to orbital calculation etc (if possible using Julia) or something like that.

elements.text: Anything related to orbital calculation etc (if possible using Julia) or something like that.

text:
Thanks! I'll look into it and report back.
Also, is it one of the eligible projects for GSoC?

elements.text:
Thanks! I'll look into it and report back.
Also, is it one of the eligible projects for GSoC?

text: JuliaAstro is part of OpenAstronomy, which usually applies as an organisation for GSoC

elements.text: JuliaAstro is part of OpenAstronomy, which usually applies as an organisation for GSoC

text: Ok I see! How can I make contributions into it? Any specific repository or project that's related to GSoC? (I'm pretty much new)

elements.text: Ok I see! How can I make contributions into it? Any specific repository or project that's related to GSoC? (I'm pretty much new)

text:
>  Any specific repository or project that's related to GSoC?
no, any project is eligible.  you can also start a new package if you want to

note that you should also make sure to find a suitable mentor for the project, someone that can guide you during your work.  you can't do a GSoC without a mentor, OpenAstronomy requires two of them actually

elements.text: Any specific repository or project that's related to GSoC?

no, any project is eligible.  you can also start a new package if you want to

note that you should also make sure to find a suitable mentor for the project, someone that can guide you during your work.  you can't do a GSoC without a mentor, OpenAstronomy requires two of them actually

text: but I think it's important you can find some projects where you can have a good understanding of: if you know the scientific domain it's much easier for you to work on it

elements.text: but I think it's important you can find some projects where you can have a good understanding of: if you know the scientific domain it's much easier for you to work on it

text:
so my recommendation is:

1. find the domain you want to work in
2. find a suitable mentor, ask them if they're willing to help you.  don't take people turning down your request personally, mentors follow their students in their free time, they need to have some time during the summer to dedicate to your project.  speaking for myself, I don't think I'll have much time this year to be a mentor

elements.text:

text: Oh so JuliaAstro under OpenAstronomy organisation participates in GSoC for which I will need two mentors. So what's the difference between JuliaAstro and JuliaSpace?

elements.text: Oh so JuliaAstro under OpenAstronomy organisation participates in GSoC for which I will need two mentors. So what's the difference between JuliaAstro and JuliaSpace?

text: JuliaAstro is for any generic astronomical/astrophysical package which doesn't have a better home.  JuliaSpace is more specifically about astrodynamics, but the main developer, Helge, is also active in JuliaAstro.  for GSoC, there might be the possibility to work on JuliaSpace packages under the OpenAstronomy umbrella, I'll need to check that, but I'm confident we can find a way around that

elements.text: JuliaAstro is for any generic astronomical/astrophysical package which doesn't have a better home.  JuliaSpace is more specifically about astrodynamics, but the main developer, Helge, is also active in JuliaAstro.  for GSoC, there might be the possibility to work on JuliaSpace packages under the OpenAstronomy umbrella, I'll need to check that, but I'm confident we can find a way around that

text: if you're interested in JuliaSpace projects, I'd suggest to reach out to Helge, he already mentored a student a couple of years ago, but no idea about his availability for next summer

elements.text: if you're interested in JuliaSpace projects, I'd suggest to reach out to Helge, he already mentored a student a couple of years ago, but no idea about his availability for next summer

text: Ok I'll reach out to mr Helge for further information about JuliaSpace projects that interest me!
